page.title: 13Employment in Llanhari
page.content: Originally the economy of the village was divided between agriculture and mining (iron ore and coal).Now there is no mining and much of the farmland has been taken over for building and by the M4 moterway.There are no factories and very little employment except for services.Most of the people now commute to the industrial estates at Bridgend,Treforest and Talbot Green or even as far afield as Cardiff.Some men are still miners but the number has dwindled to a very small number. Two big local employers are the Open Cast Coal Site at Llanharan and the Brewery at Pontyclun.Both Ysgol Gyfun Llanhari and Llanhari Primary School offer part time employment for women kitchen staff and cleaners.
